ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course was focused on learning more about different groups within the tree of life.
I learned so much about life and morphology
Bio lab skills
I learned about a wide variety of organisms from the Tree of Life, including plants, vertebrates, and invertebrates, in the context of evolution and ecological niches.
I gained a lot more lab experience with living specimens as well as some dissection experience.

I learned lab techniques related to ecology, such as microscopy, construction and application of dichotomous keys, constructing graphs, dissection, and other skills. I also learned to apply my findings to an evolutionary context and how to write lab reports.
Hands-on knowledge of the different parts of the animal kingdom
Learned so much about different forms of life and evolution!

A hands-on overview of many evolutionary biology concepts and lab procedures. This is both a supplement to bio 104 and an evolutionary biology course on its own. The class does many activities with organisms like dissections, field identification, and field trips.
I learned about invertebrate and vertebrate anantomy and ecology and evolution
This was a fun introductory lab for evolutionary bio topics! I got to build on my dissection skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I like how we focus on a different part of the tree of life each week.

Best class I've taken at Yale! The varied topics we get to learn made the class very engaging and the field trips we went on were very engaging and nice way to apply concept we learned in class. Professor Wells and the TAs were so great!
Its perfect!

Overall, the course felt like it was presented in a much more confusing and complex way than what we would actually do each week. After each lab we are expected to write up a lab report. However, most of the labs are just making observations or taking pictures of organisms, so it makes it difficult to "make" anything out of these lab reports. It seems like we are just typing words to fill space. On the other hand, I think incorporating more labs similar to labs 11/12 where we collected data and had to form our own inferences would be helpful.
Great labs! the nature walk was amazing! going into the stream was also very fun!
amazing course

This is one of the best courses Ive ever taken at Yale. I had so much fun with labs every week, and Marta and my TFs were excellent. The course provides a large variety of lab tasks, with high levels of preparation for the labs and for the weekly quizzes. I appreciated the provided study guides for the quizzes, and the intros provided in lab handouts. Sometimes lab lectures felt a bit rushed, but still provided a lot of interesting and important information.

The strengths were that the course was reliably well organized, but there were times where it just felt a bit inefficient, but that is normal for a lab setting. Also Dr. Wells is absolutely amazing and the TAs are incredibly supportive and responsive.

Strengths: Prof. Wells is super passionate and friendly, labs are really engaging and focuses on big concepts instead of minute details, very collaborative, lab reports are reasonable length, quizzes are generally pretty reasonable 

Weaknesses: none!
Strengths: Prof Wells is amazing; one of my favorite classes at Yale
Having a lab report AND quiz felt high for a half credit course, but I felt that the combination of quizzes and lab reports held us accountable and made sure we were truly learning.

There are many strengths, which include the structure of the modules themselves. Each module touches on a very specific part of the tree of life and covers a variety of engaging, hands-on activities from stream ecology to observing invertebrates under the microscope. The weakness is that sometimes the rubric for lab reports is not very clear and students are docked points unfairly (I.e. whether or not citations are important to include).
Weaknesses: I dont think the quizzes are necessary and they are just stressful and have really specific details. Maybe just a reading response style question would be more effective

The course is very engaging (mainly because of Professor Wells' humorous comments and enthusiasm) and covers big idea topics like biodiversity. It is a relatively low workload; however, if you work fast, there are days when you will have to wait around for other groups to finish before leaving lab, which was aggravating at times. Overall, good bio lab course, especially for pre-meds!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! it was very enjoyable
Yes!
YEs! A wonderful bio lab to take with friends
I would recommend this course if you have to take a bio lab. It was an interesting way to learn about ecology.
YES!! Take this lab. It is a lot of fun and you learn a lot. Best lab I've taken at Yale.
Yes
Absolutely, even if youre just interested in exploring biology! The course is fun and provides opportunities to do things you would never do otherwise, including visiting the botanical gardens.
YES!!! If you need a biology lab this one is so much fun.

Absolutely yes! This is my favorite science lab Ive taken during all 4 years at Yale. The material is so engaging and Prof. Wells makes everything so fun. The work was also very reasonable, and I felt like most students also became passionate about the work because of the wonderful teaching staff.

Id definitely recommend this class, especially for premeds who need a Bio lab. Though the lab reports can feel like busywork and the quizzes can be kind of hard, the labs themselves are so chill and fun and the Professor and TFs are super nice!
Yes, take it
Yes! Such a great way to get a bio lab in. Truly enjoyable!
Yes, this course is highly engaging and a great foundation to evolutionary biology and the tree of life. The Professor and TFs were very helpful and friendly.
If its required or u want a fun or more laid back lab
Yes! I would recommend this to those looking to fulfill a biology lab credit and are looking for an engaging, low workload lab course to do so.
